interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2014/11/23
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jon Cassar', 'Milan Cheylov', 'Adam Kane', 'Omar Madha'], 'Producers': ['Jon Cassar', 'Robert Cochran', 'Ashley Contino', 'Manny Coto', 'David Fury', 'Howard Gordon', 'Brian Grazer'], 'Studio': ['FOX']}
Review Text: I thought this newest series was more predictable than the previous seasons. It didn't make sense to me that disgraced Agent Kate Morgan - relieved of her duties and reassigned to the US - would still be authorized to wander around the facility and involve herself in a major investigation of Jack Bauer. In real  life, a Security detail would be at her desk while she packed up her personal items before she was escorted from the building. This rambling artistic license by the writers to allow Morgan to become almost a rouge agent on the job stretched credibility to me. On the other hand, I was glad to see the series included more of the real-world violence that had been edited out of the final few seasons of the previous show.  The US government had previously complained that the show suggested that government agencies routinely violated the human rights of suspects during questioning.
Review Title: Enjoyable entertainment
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
